Yes -- this is indeed 2 hours 25 minutes of 1280x544 in under 600 MB, and in quite decent, though of course not perfect, quality (H.264 is THAT good). Artifact-wise, it is better than most 700 MB DVD rips of old (thanks to MPEG-4 AVC's in-loop deblocking). Of course, that is only because most rippers didn't bother to do a 2-pass VBR back then.
Another thing: audio stream seems to be using HE-AAC (aacPlus). If your AAC decoder is outdated, audio quality may appear very low (muffled), so use up-to-date versions of ffdshow, etc.
